docs.text: this is a good year if you want plenty of sci-fi on your multiplex .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: >from the comedies mars attacks and men in black , to luc besson's powerful the fifth element , and to this , sci-fi/horror that is event horizon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( more is on the way with contact and alien : ressurection being released later this year . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is thus : in 2040 an explorer ship called the event horizon tests out a newly invented gravity drive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a device that enables a craft to travel anywhere in the universe , instantaneously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is achieved by creating a gateway , infact , a black hole , between the craft and it's required destination .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in this case , from near neptune to proxima prime .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , when the event horizon attempts this , it dissappears , without trace , leaving two searches for it fruitless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: seven years later , it reappears , transmitting a distress signal and this is where the film starts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a search and rescue ship is sent out to investigate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the team is led by laurence fishburne , and joining them is sam neill who plays the scientist that invented the gravity drive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the team search the event horizon , they find no trace of the crew but plenty of blood lying around .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not a good sign . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to make matters worse , as they search the ship , they find themselves being subjected to a series of illusions based on their own individual inner secrets and worse , some very bloody events start to occur as they slowly piece together the events that transpired on the ship seven years ago .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it soon becomes apparent that , wherever the ship went , it bought something back with it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: something very , very evil . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the first thing you'll notice in this film is it's incredible visual effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they really are eye popping , with some great models to boot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the acting is quite good , with some occasional witty moments .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sam neill does a good job as the scientist that increasingly becomes more and more disturbed as the search continues , but a tip of the hat goes to laurence fishburne who leads the team , in a cool , calm , take no nonense manner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is his acting skills that help hold this film together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the idea behind event horizon is certainly a good one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it starts off incredibly well , but the middle section becomes quite confused and sometimes muddled , leaving the viewer unsure on just what the reasons are behind some of the bloody and bizarre events that occur .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , the closing 20 minutes of the film more than make up for this , producing one the most nail biting ( or in my case , straw of my drink biting ! )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: climaxes i've recently witnessed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , event horizon is a smart film indeed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's very enjoyable and has some amazing visuals .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but be warned , the horror scenes , despite being very brief are very , very , gory .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not for the squemish !
docs.label: positive
